lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Alfred/Alfred.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Alfred.main()` (if the
code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something
like the below as the output:
What do you need from me?
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* This is the main method that will run the show for the Alfred Chatbot
* It will begin scanning for input from the user. This Chatbot has 7 commands
* 1. todo (To add a TODO task for the Chatbot)
*     What do you need from me?
* 2. deadline (To add a DEADLINE task when the user has a deadline)
*     What do you need from me?
* 3. event (To add a EVENT task when the user has an event from a certain time to a certain time)
*     What do you need from me?
* 5. mark (To mark a task based on the index)
*     What do you need from me?
* 6. unmark (To unmark a task based on the index)
* 7. delete (To delete a task based on the index)
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* This method returns the task type
* @return The task type meant for saving the tasks for the user.
* This method returns the deadline of this task
* @return The task that has just been marked
* @return The task that has just been unmarked
* This method checks if the object passed into to this method is equal to this task
* @return True if the object is equal to this or False if object is not equal
Event(String task, String from, String to) {
* This method returns the task type
* @return The task type meant for saving the tasks for the user.
* This method returns the date and time for from
* @return The date and time for from
* This method returns the date and time for to
* @return The date and time for to
* @return The task that has just been marked
* @return The task that has just been unmarked
* This method loads the saved tasks from the previous time the program was run
* and returns the ArrayList containing all the tasks saved from the previous program
Task curr = new Event(task[1], task[3], task[4]);
* This method saves the tasks from the current ArrayList into a csv file
* so it can be later loaded when the program runs again
* @param tasks that were not previously deleted
public void save(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {
* This method will take in a String input and return pair of values so
* that the Ui could easily understand what the user wants to do
* @param input containing the instruction and required inputs
* @param tasks for methods like mark, delete
* @return Pair, first value being the instruction, second value being the task you want to use it on
static Pair<String, Task> parse(String input, TaskList tasks) {
String defaultError = "I'm not sure what you're saying sir\n";
DateTimeFormatter presentable = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy h:mma");
if (todo.isBlank()) { return new Pair<>("You're missing your task Sir\n", null); }
I didn't get your deadline Sir
(Eg: deadline CLEAN THE BATMOBILE /by yyyy-MM-dd HHmm)
if (deadlineTask.isBlank()) { return new Pair<>("You're missing your task Sir\n", null); }
return new Pair<>("add", new Deadline(deadlineTask, deadline));
I can't read your deadline Sir
I didn't get your event timing Sir
(Eg: event CLEAN THE BATMOBILE /from yyyy-MM-dd HHmm /to yyyy-MM-dd HHmm)
return new Pair<>("You're missing your task Sir\n", null);
return new Pair<>("add", new Event(eventTask, from, to));
I can't read your deadline Sir
Check the list to choose which task to mark Sir
Check the list to choose which task to unmark Sir
Check the list to choose which task to delete Sir
You need to tell me a single keyword you want to find Sir
* This method checks if the task is marked, mainly meant for saving the
* leftover tasks for the next time the program runs
* @return "1" if the task is marked else "0"
* This method adds the task into the whole list of tasks
* This method deletes the task from the list of tasks
* This method gets the task of index i
* @return the task that is in that index
* This method prints the error faced when a user inputs an unknown command
* This method saves the tasks to a file for the next time the program runs
* This method returns the number of tasks
* @return The task that has just been marked
* @return The task that has just been unmarked
* This method returns the task type
* @return The task type meant for saving the tasks for the user.
* This method will read the input from the user, parse the input into an actionable
* command and run different methods based on the input. Afterwhich, it will return true
* if the chatbot should continue running and false if the user wants to exit
* @return True if the program should not exit False if the program should exit
public boolean readInput(String input) throws IOException {

return "Good morning Master!\nWhat do you need from me?\n";
Pair<String, Task> add = Parser.parse("todo Clean Batmobile", tempList);
assertEquals(new Pair<String, Task>("add", new Todo("Clean Batmobile")), add);
Pair<String, Task> wrong = Parser.parse("Clean Batmobile", tempList);
assertEquals(new Pair<String, Task>("I'm not sure what you're saying sir\n",null), wrong);
